definitions.definition: refrain from using or disposing of (something); retain for future use.
examples: roll out half the dough and reserve the other half
synonyms: earmark "ask the library to reserve a copy for you"

definitions.definition: arrange for (a room, seat, ticket, etc.) to be kept for the use of a particular person and not given to anyone else.
examples: a place was reserved for her in the front row
synonyms: preorder; Moreformalbespeak; datedengage "he reserved a table"

definitions.definition: retain or hold (an entitlement to something), especially by formal or legal stipulation.
examples: the editor reserves the right to edit letters
synonyms: hold "the management reserves the right to alter the program"

definitions.definition: refrain from delivering (a judgment or decision) immediately or without due consideration or evidence.
examples: I'll reserve my views on his ability until he's played again
synonyms: withhold "reserve your judgment until you know him better"

definitions.definition: use or engage in something only in or at (a particular circumstance or time).
examples: Japanese food has been presented as expensive and reserved for special occasions

definitions.definition: (in church use) retain (a portion of the consecrated elements) after mass for communion of the sick or as a focus for devotion.
a supply of a commodity not needed for immediate use but available if required.
examples: Australia has major coal, gas, and uranium reserves

definitions.definition: a force or body of troops kept back from action to reinforce or protect others, or additional to the regular forces and available in an emergency.
a member of the military reserve.
examples: reinforcements, the militia, extras, auxiliaries the army is calling up reserves

definitions.definition: an extra player who is a possible substitute in a team.
examples: backup, substitute, stand-in, relief, replacement, fallback, spare, extra a reserve goaltender

definitions.definition: the second-string team.
funds kept available by a bank, company, or government.
a part of a company's profits added to capital rather than paid as a dividend.
a place set aside for special use, in particular.
an area designated as a habitat for an indigenous people.
a protected area for wildlife.
examples: national park, sanctuary, preserve, conservation area, protected area, wildlife park a nature reserve

definitions.definition: a lack of warmth or openness in manner or expression.
examples: she smiled and some of her natural reserve melted
synonyms: inhibition; informalstandoffishness "it was difficult to get past his reserve"

definitions.definition: qualification or doubt attached to some statement or claim.
short for reserve price.
(in the decoration of ceramics or textiles) an area that still has the original color of the material or the color of the background.
